formalText: He's tired.
He was up late last night basking.
He's run out of Prozac and he can't renew it until tomorrow.
So he's out of it.
He just doesn't care.
He still hasn't gotten any new Klonopin and he refuses to call him.
He doesn't know why he gets anxious about the real estate stuff, but he's not as anxious as he would be about this stuff.
He's been anxious over it for so long that he finally just got used to it.
He's just got anxiety about the helplessness, but it's not like the concern he'd have about getting these payoffs and all these little things involved in closings.
It just doesn't make sense to him that this other stuff gets him so worked up.
He's concerned about how it's going to reflect on him.
He hasn't had a whole lot to be really anxious over.
He took his blood pressure down and it was high.
He's off the blood pressure medication.
He doesn't want to go back on it.
But he may have to; it sucks.
Her meds are so screwed up right now.
With the Prozac she started, she upped her dosage.
She still hasn't gotten any new Klonopin.
He's off the blood pressure medication.
It seems like Lucille is gradually more and more getting used to him.
He feels guilty though.
She was having fun titling behind his leg.
He was just exhausted.
